metadata.title: CVE-2023-29406 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
The HTTP/1 client does not fully validate the contents of the Host header.A maliciously crafted Host header can inject additional headers or entirerequests. With fix, the HTTP/1 client now refuses to send requestscontaining an invalid Request.Host or Request.URL.Host value.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-29406` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-1.17 - 1.17.13-3ubuntu1.2
golang-1.17-go - 1.17.13-3ubuntu1.2
golang-1.17-src - 1.17.13-3ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: golang-1.13 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
golang-1.17 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.17.13-3ubuntu1.2').
golang-1.18 package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
golang-1.20 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
